alert.note: Alert for Madison; Rankin; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:48PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rankin, west central Scott and southeastern Madison Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pisgah, or 11 miles west of Morton, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Rankin, west central Scott and southeastern Madison Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
